alert.note: Alert for Cheshire (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 5:08PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cheshire County through 545 PM EDT... At 507 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Erving, or 7 miles east of Greenfield, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Keene, Jaffrey, Peterborough, Rindge, Winchester, Dublin, Richmond, Harrisville, Nelson, Marlborough, Gilsum, Westmoreland, Swanzey, Hinsdale, Roxbury, Fitzwilliam, Troy, Sullivan, Surry and Chesterfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
